byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, top human rights official at United Nations, refers to weeks-long bombardment and siege of rebel-held area of Aleppo as crimes of epic scale that have turned city into slaughterhouse; calls for war crimes investigation.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Seeks War Crimes Inquiry Into Aleppo ‘Horror’
headline.main: Aleppo Is a ‘Slaughterhouse,’ Says U.N. Official Seeking War Crimes Inquiry

snippet: As a “humanitarian pause” in attacks, declared unilaterally by Russia, entered a second day, the high commissioner for human rights called for a new investigation....
